title: Holy Spirit, titles and descriptions of

children.title: Holy Spirit, titles and names of
children.comment: The names and terms for the Holy Spirit relate to his power, activity and presence in the world, often indicating the nature of his actions or the gifts which he conveys to believers.

children.title: Holy Spirit, descriptions of
children.comment: Though himself invisible, the Holy Spirit may appear in symbolic form and his activities may be described metaphorically.

children.title: The dove
The wind or breath

primaryrefs.comment: This phenomenon accompanied the filling with the Spirit.

seealsos.comment: The same Hebrew word is here translated ``breath'', ``wind'' and ``spirit''

children.title: The fire
The oil of anointing
Water
A seal
A deposit
A guide or shepherd
A voice
God's gift
The power of God
Holy Spirit, as Counsellor
children.comment: The Holy Spirit is the one who comforts, advises and strengthens Christians, drawing them closer to Jesus Christ.

children.title: The Holy Spirit is Counsellor in addition to Jesus Christ
Jesus Christ is a Counsellor

primaryrefs.comment: One Greek word ``Parakletos'' underlies this phrase which is primarily a legal term. It can also bear the meaning ``comforter''.

children.title: The Spirit is another Counsellor

primaryrefs.comment: The word ``another'' means ``another of the same kind''. After the ascension, the Spirit is to assume the ministry of Jesus Christ.

children.title: The Counsellor is the gift of the exalted Christ
The Counsellor comforts and reassures believers

secondaryrefs.comment: Peter is reassured about going to the house of Cornelius
Believers are reassured that they are God's children.

children.title: The Counsellor strengthens and equips the church

seealsos.comment: The Jerusalem church is strengthened in the face of opposition
the church in Judea, Galilee and Samaria

children.title: The Counsellor teaches and instructs believers
The Spirit reminds the disciples of Jesus Christ's teaching
The Spirit teaches the church further truth
The Counsellor helps the church in its mission
The Spirit testifies to Jesus Christ and helps the church to do likewise
The Spirit convicts the unbelieving world
Examples of the Spirit's help in witness and mission
The Counsellor draws believers closer to Jesus Christ
Holy Spirit, as teacher
children.comment: Having instructed God's people in the OT and Jesus Christ's disciples in the NT, the Spirit of truth continues to reveal the truth of God to believers.
